attributes.action: Do something about the teenage gang culture in the UK
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The teenage gang culture in the UK is way out of control. Innocent people are being senselessly attacked &, in some cases, killed for either standing up to or remonstrating with what are effectively, children. The do-gooders in this country have seen to it that neither parents, teachers nor the police   can chastise these kids & brave men like 47 year-old Garry Newlove, a husband & father himself, & many others like him, have paid the ultimate price for attempting to protect their own or other peoples property. Respect for elders has all but gone & it's utterly disgraceful. We urge the PM to allow parents & authoritive figures to deal with children that have either committed or are inciting to commit serious crime, in the manner in which WE were dealt with when WE were younger, & to do away with the ridiculous 'nanny  state' that we've ended up with.

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "Do something about the teenage gang culture in the UK."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.pm.gov.uk/output/Page14941.asp

Prime Minister's Office
